moves.1. e4 e6 2. Nf3: my favorite line against what I thought would be the french...
moves.3. d4: staking a claim to the center
moves.4. e5: maybe not the best move, but an aggressive one nonetheless
moves.6. Kxd1 f5 7. Bc4 Be7 8. Bf4 h6 9. Nc3 c: brings the king into the game, connects the rooks
moves.10... b5 11. Bb3 Bb4 12. Nd4 Bxc3: opens the b file for later attacks...
moves.13. bxc3 g5 14. Bd2 Ke7 15. c4: clearing out the b file completely
moves.15... bxc4 16. Bxc4 a5 17. Rhb1: threatens Rxb8 followed by Rxb8 and Nxb8 , forking the king and rook
moves.18... Rxb8 19. Nxc6+ Kf7 20. Nxb8: all of a sudden the game has been busted wide open
moves.20... Bb7 21. Bxa5 Bxg2 22. Rd1 f3+: last ditch checking attempt inadvertently traps his bishop
moves.23. Ke3 Ne7: attacks my knight prepares for a last ditch check
moves.27... Ke8: bad way to remove the pin, allows me to take e6
moves.29. Nc7+ Kf8: moves his king away from his other pieces
moves.30... Kg8 31. Rf6+: gets rid of his rook and moves his knight away if he takes the bishop back
moves.33... Kg8 34. Rxh6: removes the defender of g5 so my knight can go there after Rg6  if he goes Kh8, then Nf7  , if Kf7 then Rg7  Ke8 and then Bd7
